Compute coverage of y intervals over x intervals

Compute coverage of y intervals over x intervals

bed_coverage(x, y, strand = FALSE, strand_opp = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x
tbl of intervals
y
tbl of intervals
strand
intersect intervals on same strand
strand_opp
intersect intervals on opposite strands
...
extra arguments (not used)

Note

Book-ended intervals are counted as overlapping by default

See also

http://bedtools.readthedocs.org/en/latest/content/tools/coverage.html

Examples

x <- tibble::tribble(
~chrom, ~start, ~end,
"chr1", 100,    500,
"chr2", 200,    400,
"chr2", 300,    500,
"chr2", 800,    900
)

y <- tibble::tribble(
~chrom, ~start, ~end, ~value,
"chr1", 150,    400,  100,
"chr1", 500,    550,  100,
"chr2", 230,    430,  200,
"chr2", 350,    430,  300
)

bed_coverage(x, y)
#> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 7
#>   chrom start   end .intersections .basecoverage .x_length .fraction
#>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl>          <int>         <int>     <int>     <dbl>
#> 1  chr1   100   500              2           250       400     0.625
#> 2  chr2   200   400              2           170       200     0.850
#> 3  chr2   300   500              2           130       200     0.650
#> 4  chr2   800   900              0             0       100     0.000
#>
